$$id.description: The unique id of the component, mainly used to locate json nodes in the page designer

$ref.description: Used together with definitions, an infinite loop renderer can be implemented.

id.description: The unique id of the component, mainly used for log collection

staticPlaceholder.description: Static display of empty value placeholder

staticClassName.description: Static display form item class name

staticLabelClassName.description: Static display of form item Label class name

staticInputClassName.description: Static display of form item Value class name

behavior.description: Component behavior and usage, such as create, update, remove

displayName.description: Component name, usually the business name for easy location

mock.description: Editor fake data for easy display

editorSetting.description: Editor configuration, can be ignored at runtime

useMobileUI.description: Can be used to turn off mobile style at the component level

labelWidth.description: Label custom width, default unit is px

name.description: Field name, key when submitting the form, supports multi-level, use . to connect, such as: a.b.c

extraName.description: Additional field name, when used as a range component, can be used to flatten out another value

remark.description: Display a small icon and display prompt content when the mouse is placed on it

labelRemark.description: Display a small icon. When the mouse is placed on it, the prompt content is displayed. This small icon is together with the label.

submitOnChange.description: Whether to submit the form when modifications are completed.

validateOnChange.description: If it is not set, every modification of the form item after the form is submitted will trigger re-validation. If it is set, this configuration item will determine whether to trigger validation every time it is modified.

description.description: Describe content and support Html fragments.

mode.description: Configure the current form item display mode

horizontal.description: When configured as a horizontal layout, it is used to configure specific left and right distribution.

inline.description: Whether the form control is in inline mode.

isFloat.description: Whether it is floating point type

isLength.description: The length is equal to the specified value

isUrl.description: Whether it is a URL address

maxLength.description: The maximum length is the specified value

maximum.description: The maximum value is the specified value

minLength.description: The minimum length is the specified value

minimum.description: The minimum value is the specified value

isDateTimeSame.description: Same as target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeBefore.description: Earlier than the target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeAfter.description: Later than the target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeSameOrBefore.description: Earlier than the target date or the same as the target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeSameOrAfter.description: Later than the target date or the same as the target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeBetween.description: The date is within the target date range, and supports the opening and closing forms of specified granularity and interval. The default is milliseconds, and the left and right open intervals are

isTimeSame.description: Same as target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeBefore.description: Earlier than the target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeAfter.description: Later than the target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeSameOrBefore.description: Earlier than the target time or the same as the target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeSameOrAfter.description: Later than the target time or the same as the target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeBetween.description: The time is within the target time range, and supports the opening and closing forms of specified granularity and intervals. The default is milliseconds, and the left and right open intervals are

value.description: The default value, please remember that it can only be a static value. Variables are not supported. Association with data is achieved by setting the name attribute.

clearValueOnHidden.description: When a form item is hidden, whether to delete the form item value in the current Form. Note that unhidden form item values with the same name will also be deleted.

autoFill.description: After uploading, synchronize other fields to the form.

initAutoFill.description: Whether to synchronize other fields to the form during initialization.

accept.description:
By default, only plain text is supported. To support other types, please configure this property. It is recommended to directly fill in the file suffix, such as: .txt, .csv

 Separate multiple types with commas.

capture.description: Control the capture attribute of the input tag for taking photos or videos on the mobile terminal.

asBase64.description: If the uploaded file is relatively small, you can set this option to simply submit the base64 value of the file to the form. Currently, multiple selections are not supported.

asBlob.description: If you do not want the File component to be uploaded, you can configure `asBlob` or `asBase64`. In this way, the component no longer uploads itself, but directly uses the file data as the value of the form item. The file content will be included in the Form form submission interface.

chunkApi.description: The default `/api/upload/chunk` requires attention only if you want to store it yourself.

downloadUrl.description:
By default, displaying file paths supports direct download. You can add a prefix like: `http://xx.dom/filename=`. If you don't want this, you can set this configuration item to `false`.

Starting from version 1.1.6, it will support variables ${xxx} to construct download addresses yourself, and supports configuration as post.

fileField.description: Defaults to `file`, you can omit this attribute if you don't want to store it yourself.

finishChunkApi.description: The default `/api/upload/finishChunkApi` requires attention only if you want to store it yourself.

hideUploadButton.description: Whether to hide the upload button

maxSize.description: There is no limit by default. When set, files larger than this value will not be allowed to be uploaded.

receiver.description: Default `/api/upload/file` Set this option if you want to store it yourself.

startChunkApi.description: The default `/api/upload/startChunk` requires attention only if you want to store it yourself.

useChunk.description: The default is 'auto'. The server where amis is located limits the file upload size to no more than 10M, so when the user selects a large file, amis will automatically change to the chunked upload mode.

joinValues.description: 1. Radio selection mode: When the user selects an option, the value in the option will be submitted as the value of the form item. Otherwise, the entire option object will be submitted as the value of the form item. 2. Multi-selection mode: The `value` of multiple selected options will be connected through `delimiter`, otherwise the value will be submitted directly in the form of an array.

extractValue.description: After it is turned on, the value of the selected option value is encapsulated into an array and used as the value of the current form item.

valueField.description: Which of the data returned by the interface is used as the value?

nameField.description: Which of the data returned by the interface is used to display the file name?

urlField.description: Which of the data returned by the interface is used as the download address.

drag.description: Whether to drag and drop upload
